  • Snow storm and competitive analysis

     Mar 14, 2017

    The north east got hit by a mix of snow/sleet last night. I woke up to a snowy driveway and a competitor on Designer News called Buckets.

    They are a visual bookmarking tool that takes screenshots of urls. It's built in wordpress and got a decent amount of upvotes on Product Hunt.

    It's definitely a good sign and shows that users continue to face a problem when trying to collect content online. The team and I are learning a lot from analyzing the product and the comments that they've received.

  • Mobile registration switch redo

     Mar 13, 2017

    We made a lot of updates to user registration which includes a way for users to reset their passwords. I had to update the frontend to account for the changes which included reimplementing the mobile login switch.

  • Footer for eego

     Mar 12, 2017

    We made a footer for eego that will show on all static pages.

    I'll be finishing the FAQ next.

  • A trip to the Smithsonian

     Mar 11, 2017

    This morning I went to the Smithsonian Museum of Natural History with Kristina and a few of her friends.

    It's pretty incredible that DC has multiple world renown museums that are all free!

  • 4DWW Studio

     Mar 10, 2017

    I've been continuing to consult for a web broadcasting company and got the chance to see the studio they've created to achieve professional grade livestreaming.

    The technology is extremely impressive and the room-size green screen setup allows for different backdrops for the broadcasts.

  • New Brand and Landing Page

     Mar 9, 2017

    We're changing the brand from Stash to eego. This transition is about a month in the making, but we're finally ready to begin the rebranding.

    While Stash is a fairly good name, it is highly overused and terrible for brand recognition in SEO, especially with a .ag domain name.

    Osebo came up with eego because collections serve as a symbol of an individual's identity. With that in mind, our goal is to help people create collections they're proud of.

  • Job apps galore

     Mar 8, 2017

    I've been applying to a ton of positions in NYC for front-end development and product management. There are some great opportunities where I feel I can make a significant impact.

    I'm just starting to hear back and I'm excited to start interviewing!

  • Reset your password

     Mar 7, 2017

    To close out Stash's user registration, we've added a forgot your password flow that sends users an email with a link to reset their password.

  • Footer update for all pages

     Mar 6, 2017

    The contact section on my homepage served as a footer, but it didn't feel like a footer and it wasn't practical to use on every page of my site. I remade the contact section into a universal footer to achieve a consistent experience.

    It is mobile friendly as well with the text links transforming into icons at the 600px breakpoint.
